A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The more I've thought about TLJ the more I dislike it. Plot holes\, bad characterization\, unbelievable motivations\, corny/cheesy humor that doesn't fit\, a theme at odds with virtually every other story of the main saga\, and worst of all a plot that has our protagonists virtually in the same place as when the movie starts. 

I mean\, if you had to come up with one brief phrase to describe where the heroes are at the start\, and another at the end of the movie it would be the same phrase. 

That's pretty crappy story-telling. 

All the problems people complain about the prequels are here in spades. 

It can be redeemed only if JJ takes this apparently new direction and smashes it to bits in episode ix. Otherwise this movie essentially makes other movies in the saga worse/less enjoyable by the choices it makes (for me). 

As far as enjoyability\, this one is now currently just above Phantom. 

Maybe a second viewing will change my mind. I'll find out at noon today.
